title: Bond Markets Flash Turmoil, and No One Else Much Cares
sub_head: The vast infusion of money by governments and central banks into the economy may have anesthetized investors
body:
Investors have jolted government bond markets in the past month as they reassess what will happen to the basic cost of money that underpins the financial system.
Yet, other markets donâ€™t seem to care. Stocks have hit new highs, currencies have if anything moved the opposite way to what would normally be expected and corporate bonds remained impassive.
